title: Textile, 18th–19th century
medium:
Medium: linen
Technique: supplementary looped wefts in plain weave foundation
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 284 x 45 cm (9 ft. 3 13/16 in. x 17 11/16 in.)
description: One panel from a bedcover. Pattern produced by widely spaced heavy loops. In the center is a panel with geometric shapes flanking the cross and both ends are patterned by a diagonal arrangement of small diamonds. One selvage remains.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 18th–19th century.Medium: linen
Technique: supplementary looped wefts in plain weave foundation. 1972-36-12.
